projectPurpose: To provide a simple, powerful, and versatile command-line tool for running and testing HTTP requests using a plain text file format, suitable for fetching data and performing API testing in various contexts, including development and CI/CD pipelines.
mainFeatures: Run HTTP requests defined in a simple plain text format
Evaluate queries (XPath, JSONPath) on headers and body
Assert on HTTP status code and response headers
Supports various APIs (REST, SOAP, GraphQL) and HTML

alternatives.name: curl
alternatives.license: Open Source (curl license, inspired by MIT/X)
mainFeatures: Supports numerous protocols (HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, etc.)

alternatives.name: Insomnia
alternatives.license: Open Source (Apache License 2.0) for desktop app

marketPositioning: Hurl positions itself as a simple, powerful, and versatile command-line tool for running and testing HTTP requests, serving as a lightweight alternative to GUI clients like Postman and Insomnia, and offering a more human-friendly and test-oriented approach compared to raw curl. Its plain text file format makes it ideal for automation, scripting, and integration into CI/CD workflows, targeting developers and DevOps professionals who prefer a CLI-centric approach for API testing and interaction.
